question: Which famous award is also called as the Asia’s version of the Nobel Prize?
explanation:
The Ramon Magsaysay awards, regarded as Asia’s version of the Nobel Prize, have been cancelled this year due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
This is only the third time the annual awards were cancelled in the past six decades. Earlier, the awards were cancelled due to a financial crisis in 1970 and a terrible earthquake that hit the Philippines in 1990. The awards are provided by a Manila-based foundation and named after the third president of the Republic of the Philippines after World War II.
